New Records: The Los Angeles Dodgers secured a 2-0 World Series lead for the first time since 1988.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani partially dislocated his left shoulder while sliding into second base.
Tommy Edman and Teoscar Hernández hit home runs off Carlos Rodón.
Alex Vesia recorded his first postseason save with a crucial first-pitch flyout.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge discussed his struggles at the plate, emphasizing the need to expand his swing.
Alex Vesia reflected on his successful postseason debut, stating it was a 'pivotal moment' for the Yankees.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees were held to one hit until the ninth inning.
The game marked the first time the Yankees were 0-2 since 2001.
Others: Yoshinobu Yamamoto, the Dodgers' rookie pitcher, was praised for his performance despite the loss.
The Dodgers' victory extended their World Series lead, creating a significant historical milestone.
